q: Page, now 37 and greying. While Eric Schmidt travels the world meeting with business partners, government officials and potential takeover targets, Page says he will be making most of the big decisions as he tries to rekindle the soul and passion of a startup. Sergey Brin will concentrate on developing new products. He's worth$ 15 billion, but Page remains something of a rebel who has always had a disdain for corporate protocol.

Kirsten Gillibrand , by contrast, was an obscure one-term House member from a conservative, rural district. She faced prejudice not just as a woman but as an upstater, says Robert Zimmerman, a top Democratic fundraiser in New York. Chief Executive Officer Steve Ballmer plans to extend a management shake-up aimed at adding senior product executives with an engineering background, two people with knowledge of the decision said," Dina Bass reports for Bloomberg. Changes may be announced this month, said one of the people, who declined to be named because the plans are private, Bass reports. "Last month, Steve Ballmer pushed out server division president and 23- year company veteran Bob Muglia, saying the company needed new leadership that could focus on areas such as cloud software."

The three didn't always agree, particularly when it came to coping with rules in China that require Web-search providers to censor results that government officials deem inappropriate. Asked whether he planned to stay another four years at Google to collect stock awards worth$ 100 million, Eric Schmidt said: Yes, that is my plan. Google said last month co-founder Larry Page would take over as chief executive from April 4 while Eric Schmidt would assume the role of executive chairman.

President Bush at a Feb. 3, 2003, National Security Council meeting in which Colin Powell sketched out the presentation he was to make at the U.N. two days later. Donald Rumsfeld quotes himself as telling the meeting, We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it. Khurmal is the name of a village near the site.
